revised_title: Observations of Mars' Extensive Atmosphere and the Accuracy of Cassini and Roemer's Observations
tldr: The author, James South, conducted observations of Mars and a nearby star to study the planet's extensive atmosphere. He found no evidence of any optical changes or projections on Mars' disk during the observation. South concluded that either a physical change has occurred in Mars' atmosphere or the accuracy of the observations made by Cassini and Roemer must be considered unreliable.
